heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 26 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (176°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (230.0°) by approximately 54.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 2.3°C), more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 5%), and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 309 m) and inside temperature (up 1.5°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 405.3m lower than yesterday, 196.4m lower than the past week, 308.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 845m and a peak of 2560m, averaging 999.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, overcast skies with low cloud, and the light is absent. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
